intro: Foetidia vohemarensis, commonly known as the Vohemarensis orchid, is a rare and endemic species native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its unique floral structure and vivid coloration. The plant typically grows in humid, shaded environments within specific forest habitats. Its flowers are often short-lived but attract a variety of pollinators, including bees and certain moths. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
